resources.string: You could trigger Locus Map actions in your Tasker task or Tasker can listen for Locus Map events

Currently only some parts of the Locus API are implemented in this plugin. Please share your Tasker project idea if you miss any API implementations to make me able to create a proper translation to Tasker variables: https://github.com/Falcosc/locus-addon-tasker/issues
Track \'%1$s\' is set, now you could use the Tasker field \'%2$s\' from \'%3$s\'. Reverse tracks are not supported. If something goes wrong you get the following returns values:
offTRK - Guiding is of or your next point is not part of the selected track
This event is not properly implemented, if you want to use it please ask for a Tasker event implementation by sharing your Tasker project idea to tell which data you need.
For now you can manually execute one of your tasks and get all event data as \'\%data\' in form of useless IDs to preview:
This action is currently not implemented because nobody did request this. Please share your Tasker project idea at Github to tell me how I should implement this API to be useful at Tasker.
Your app setup does not support variables
Your app setup does not Synchronous execution to handle variables
Your app setup does not support return variables
Your app setup did not set Synchronous execution to handle variables

You did select one or more fields which need to know your current navigation track. Currently Locus API don\'t return the current navigation track. This app try to guess which track is your navigation but if you have any problems you need to manually select which track is your Navigation.
It is suggested to select the virtual navigation track.
